DataElement.preferredName: Viral Hepatitis Laboratory Procedure Serology Test Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes the kind of serological laboratory test used to determine the positive or negative test result for hepatitis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Viral Hepatitis Laboratory Procedure Serological Test Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic inflammation of the liver parenchyma caused by viruses. Representative examples include hepatitis A, B, and C, cytomegalovirus hepatitis, and herpes simplex hepatitis._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens._The technique used to administer a particular examination or assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic inflammation of the liver parenchyma caused by viruses. Representative examples include hepatitis A, B, and C, cytomegalovirus hepatitis, and herpes simplex hepatitis.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic inflammation of the liver parenchyma caused by viruses. Representative examples include hepatitis A, B, and C, cytomegalovirus hepatitis, and herpes simplex hepatitis.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:The technique used to administer a particular examination or assessment.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
The technique used to administer a particular examination or assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA Liver enrollment form per request by K.Dicostanzo. mc 7/21/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of hepatitis B virus DNA in a sample.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the amount of hepatitis B virus DNA in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An assay used to determine which hepatitis B virus genome(s) is present in an infection. Seven genotypes of HBV (designated A through G) have been identified. Different genotypes are prevalent in different geographical areas and each carries a different risk of development of hepatocellular carcinoma.

Concepts.definition: An assay used to determine which hepatitis B virus genome(s) is present in an infection. Seven genotypes of HBV (designated A through G) have been identified. Different genotypes are prevalent in different geographical areas and each carries a different risk of development of hepatocellular carcinoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Measurement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Measurement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of Hepatitis B virus core antibody present in a sample.

Concepts.longName: Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Measurement
Concepts.definition: The determination of the amount of Hepatitis B virus core antibody present in a sample.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hepatitis B Virus Surface Antigen Measurement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hepatitis B Virus Surface Antigen Measurement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A deteremination of the presence of hepatitis B virus surface antigen.

Concepts.longName: Hepatitis B Virus Surface Antigen Measurement
Concepts.definition: A determination of the presence of hepatitis B virus surface antigen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the surface antibody reaction of a sample to the Hepatitis B virus.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the surface antibody reaction of a sample to the Hepatitis B virus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An assay for determining the genotype(s) of hepatitis C virus (HCV) in plasma or serum from HCV-infected individuals. Six major genotypes are recognized and they vary in their response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: An assay for determining the genotype(s) of hepatitis C virus (HCV) in plasma or serum from HCV-infected individuals. Six major genotypes are recognized and they vary in their response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement of the Hepatitis C RNA in a biological specimen.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of the Hepatitis C RNA in a biological specimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of the antibody reaction of a biological specimen to the Hepatitis C virus.

Concepts.definition: A quantitative measurement of the antibody reaction of a biological specimen to the Hepatitis C virus.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
